posts.post_content:
I don't see how this guy is unplayable. He is dragon/wizard, he might be one of the few pure red cards that let you draw, He makes using ramp and putting him out there to send your ([bloodghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=bloodghast) or [demigod of revenge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=demigod of revenge) ) in re animators easy I don't see a problem hitting an opponent for 5 than drawling tons of [shock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=shock ) effect spells to end the game.   
 Dragon storm him much since you play combo you have no hand he helps refill again.   
What is really not to love?

posts.post_content:
Given both his ability and flavor text, I think he's meant for a deck that uses Madness cards.
  
See [Fiery Temper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fiery Temper), [Call to the Netherworld](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Call to the Netherworld), [Dark Withering](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Withering), [Gibbering Descent](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gibbering Descent) (which also facilitates Madness), [Violent Eruption](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Violent Eruption), [Reckless Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reckless Wurm), etc.
  
This guy could easily be a game-ender in a Madness deck.
posts.html:
Given both his ability and flavor text, I think he's meant for a deck that uses Madness cards.
See Fiery Temper, Call to the Netherworld, Dark Withering, Gibbering Descent (which also facilitates Madness), Violent Eruption, Reckless Wurm, etc.
This guy could easily be a game-ender in a Madness deck.

posts.post_content:
This is maybe the only Dragon 'serious' [Kaalia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kaalia) players will consider anymore.  
  
Johnnies who had to think 'how do we make this EVEN dumber' came up with this tho: Scion of the Ur-Dragon, slide Kaalia to the 99. 5-color, 3-tribe, super broken bonkers deck? ENABLED.  
  
EDIT: Hmm....i was thinking that after Griselbrand and Gisela were spoiled, that AVR would give so many great Angels and Demons, that Dragons would be too hard to find room for. I was wrong though- they've definitely made some competitive worthy Dragons since then, and a little number of Old Dragons still have teeth enough to be worth looking at-- but I do think Dragons are more likely to be outdated by Newer cards than Angels (who will always have Akroma and now Avacyn) or Demons (who will probably always have Reiver Demon and definitely always Griselbrand and Rakdos, the Defiler).   
  
This is the only Dragon I think is unlikely to get outdated anytime soon though, the way other cards look. Big Fat Flyers ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
